context: The Finnish word 'saakka' is a postposition that indicates a limit or endpoint in time or space. It’s often translated as ‘until’ or ‘up to’. The meaning depends on the case of the preceding noun; with the illative or allative cases, it signifies ‘up to’, ‘all the way to’, or ‘until’. For example, 'kaupungin keskustaan saakka' means 'up to the city center', and 'iltaan saakka' means 'until evening'. It can also indicate a starting point in time with 'siitä saakka' meaning 'ever since then'.
